name: Einsamkeit: Halwende: Episode 2 Preview
description:
The Madness Intensifies

The shock following the game's first casualties spreads rapidly. A handful of survivors actively search for ways to get those who remain out alive. Other, more disheveled participants begin sowing seeds of doubt in everyone’s minds with baseless accusations that may have dire consequences. 

However, there is one thing that all the participants have in common regardless of which course of action they’ve taken: despite their unfortunate and undesirable lives, they still cling to the thought of a better tomorrow. Though now, even with what they thought to be the key to their happiness dangling in front of them, this "better tomorrow" is life the way it was just mere days ago.

Still, even with the fear and hopelessness they feel, something even darker is in store for them. Those who’ve died aren’t happy and have returned to haunt the remaining participants. Not only that, but literal ghosts from their pasts are beginning to reveal themselves as well. 

No one feels safe anymore. No one knows if what’s happening is even real. Some are starting to question that if they do win the brighter future they’ve always wanted, will they even be sane enough to enjoy it?

It is HIGHLY recommended to play the first episode before playing either the preview or Einsamkeit: Halwende Episode Two when it releases.

This is not a game for children or the faint of heart

Einsamkeit: Halwende contains sensitive and mature topics that may trigger some and are not suitable for younger audiences.

Features  You Choose the Game

There’s more than one way for the mastermind's game to unfold. Make choices that can alter the story drastically not only in this episode, but the episodes to come, creating a vast branch of different endings by the final episode.

Complete Unpredictability 

A death game story would be a little generic nowadays if there was a main character who was guaranteed to live, even in the canon ending... so the story is told in multiple perspectives, giving everyone proportionate importance.

Multiple Styles of Horror 

Einsamkeit: Halwende is described as a supernatural horror drama because those are the main horror elements, but there’s also psychological horror, slasher, body, & monster horror! (Not all types appear in the first episode.)

A Unique and Diverse Cast

Einsamkeit: Halwende’s story would be bland if all the characters were similar, so you’ll see all kinds of folks from different strokes: a nice mixture of races, ages, social classes, sexual orientations, etc.

 Ainsley:

An employee at Motel 7 Heaven who wants nothing more than the end of human suffering. He only means well, but due to his lack of social skills he is often mistaken as a creepy individual.

 Nyx:

A law student at the local college. Ever since high school she's claimed to have been stalked by a former foster sibling, but not only does no one believe her, no one seems to remember the atrocities the child committed when he stayed with her family as well.

 Christie:

Nyx's roommate and one of her best friends. She's a very sociable girl who anyone can get along with, yet no one truly knows her or her past.

 Layle:

A good friend of Christie and Nyx. He's at their school studying music theory, but because he comes from a well-off family it’s often wondered why he ended up at no-name school since he could've gone anywhere with his parents' coin.

 Asreal:

The only therapist in town. He has somewhat of a god complex and must always have control of any situation. As the therapist of some of the other characters he comes off as the one who holds the most standing in the game.

 Lily:

A woman who has Asreal in the palm of her hand. She goes to him to ease her family who believes she has a strong addiction to sex, but there's more to her than anyone could fathom.

 Dolores: 

Known all over town for her insanity, Dolores is a woman beyond any salvation. She wants to kill Asreal more than anything for reasons that made him quit the asylum he worked at before starting his own practice.

 Travis:

As one of Dolores' twin sons, Travis has been bullied relentlessly for as long as he can remember because of his mother's reputation. He and his brother Trystin—who've freshly turned eighteen—want nothing more than to leave town, and with it their suffering.

 Devon: 

Also known as Super Remix, Devon is a boy who believes himself to be a hero of justice and will punish anyone he deems evil without the slightest hesitation.

 Erburus: 

An eccentric amnesiac who knows nothing of his life beyond two years ago. He only ever speaks in esoterics, and for some reason has an obsession with Ainsley.

 Toni: 

One of the only two contestants who knows a bit about what's going on. She's as calculated and calm as she is beautiful, and she won't stop until she gets what she wants.

 Cecil:

Toni's only friend, and the only other person who has any idea of what's happening. He's a hacker who makes his living by syphoning money and valuable information from the upper class, though gives most of his earnings to those in need.

 Thomas:

A boy much smarter than his age and appearance would suggest. He parades his mother around on a leash, as she can do nothing but drool and speak infant-like jargon.

Release Style 

Due to our life style as students, Einsamkeit: Halwende will be split into five (donation optional) episodes on itch, and you will be able to continue from where you left off from episode to episode.
